page.title: 03HEALTH
page.content: Longfield does not have a hospital of its own;residents must go to either Dartford or Gravesend. The nearest casualty department is at West Hill Hospital,Dartford. Many residents are in a position to afford private health care and there is a private hospital a few miles away in Fawkham. Primary health care is provided from within Longfield by General Practitioners. Attached to these doctors are nurses,and health visitors, who visit patients in their own homes. The National Health Service funds the hospitals and provides the doctors and nurses. Prescription charges are currently Â£2.00 per item. Prescriptions are dispensed by the chemists in Station Road.
